Package edu.cmu.cs.prt

Class PrtSchedule.Selector

java.lang.Object
edu.cmu.cs.prt.PrtSchedule.Selector
Enclosing class:
PrtSchedule
public static class PrtSchedule.Selector extends Object
Builder pattern that allows customized querying of schedule.

To get a list of trips with the customizable parameters, follow the builder pattern by chaining the parameters. To get the result of the customized query, call .trips().

For example, to get all available trips for 61D, heading outbound, during 6:00pm and 10:30pm today, use the following chain of parameters: 

 Route route = PrtInfo.routeOf("61D").get();
 List<ScheduledTrip> trips = new PrtSchedule.Selector().forRoute(route)
                                                   .onDate(LocalDate.now())
                                                   .inDirection(RouteDirection.OUTBOUND)
                                                   .after(LocalTime.of(18, 0))
                                                   .before(LocalTime.of(22, 30))
                                                   .trips();

    • onDate

      public PrtSchedule.Selector onDate(LocalDate date)
      Query the schedule based on the input date.

      The date's day of the week time must match what is entered for onDayOfWeek(), if any was provided.

      Parameters:
      date - Date on which a scheduled trip is serviced
      Returns:
      This selector
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If date doesn't match what is entered for onDayOfWeek()

    • onDayOfWeek

      public PrtSchedule.Selector onDayOfWeek(DayOfWeek dayOfWeek)
      Query the schedule based on the input day of the week.

      The day of the week time must match that of what is entered for onDate(), if any was provided.

      Parameters:
      dayOfWeek - Day of the week on which a scheduled trip is serviced
      Returns:
      This selector
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If dayOfWeek doesn't match that of what is entered for date()

    • after

      public PrtSchedule.Selector after(LocalTime time)
      Query the schedule for trips scheduled after the input time.

      For example, after(LocalTime.of(6,0)) will limit resulting trips' start times to after 06:00 or 6:00am.

      The input time must be before the time entered for before(), if any was provided.

      Parameters:
      time - Time after which scheduled trips should start
      Returns:
      This selector
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If time is after time entered for before()

    • before

      public PrtSchedule.Selector before(LocalTime time)
      Query the schedule for trips scheduled before the input time.

      For example, before(LocalTime.of(16,0)) will limit resulting trips' start times to before 16:00 or 4:00pm.

      The input time must be after the time entered for after(), if any was provided.

      Parameters:
      time - Time before which scheduled trips should start
      Returns:
      This selector
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If time is before time entered for after()

    • trips

      public List<ScheduledTrip> trips()
      Returns all trips that satisfy the parameters given to this selector.
      Returns:
      List of trips that satisfy the input parameters
